What is the primary purpose of HTML?
answer_1: HTML is responsible for the structure, styling, and interactivity of webpages.
answer_2: HTML structures the webpage, identifying its elements such as paragraphs, headings, and lists.
answer_3: HTML is responsible for the structure and styling of webpages.
answer_4: HTML structures and provides a rudimentary look to webpages.
correct: HTML structures the webpage, identifying its elements such as paragraphs, headings, and lists.

Which statement is false?
answer_1: Inline elements can be nested inside block elements.
answer_2: Block elements can be nested inside inline elements.
answer_3: Block elements can be nested inside block elements.
answer_4: Inline elements can be nested inside inline elements.
correct: Block elements can be nested inside inline elements.

title: what is the correct way to describe an empty element?
answer_1: It has child but no closing tag.
answer_2: It dissplay nothing on a webside.
answer_3: It has opening and closing tags but no child content
answer_4: It has no chlid content and no closing tag.
correct: It has opening and closing tags but no child content

title: When should you use the <article> element?
answer_1: for the main content area of your website.
answer_2: when the content stands alone as a unit, is suitable for syndication, or is reusable.
answer_3: to associate comments with a blog post.
answer_4: for blog posts and other social media items.
correct: when the content stands alone as a unit, is suitable for syndication, or is reusable.

What is the difference between the <head> and <header> tags?
answer_1: There is only one <head> tag per page, while there may be many <header> tags.
answer_3: The <head> tag contains meta information, while the <header> tag contains navigation, logos, and other page identifying content.
answer_4: The <head> tag may contain CSS and JavaScript links, while the <header> tag may contain headings and navigational links.
correct: There is only one <head> tag per page, while there may be many <header> tags.

answer_2: when linking style sheets, favicons, and preloading assets

correct: when linking style sheets and favicons
